provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. This Order may be cited as the Extended Jurisdiction in Clarendon
of the Resident Magistrate for Manchester as Coroner Order, 1934.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The area set out in the Schedule is hereby prescribed to be the area schedule.
in the parish of Clarendon over which the jurisdiction of the Resident
Magistrate for Manchester as Coroner shall extend.
                                     SMEDULE                       (Paragraph 2)
   From the point on the Yankee River where the four parishes, Manchester,
Clarendon, St. Ann and Trelawny meet, down the centre of the Yankee River
to its confluence with the Cave River; thence down the centre of the Cave River
to where it is crossed by the parochial road leading from Borobridge through
Morgan’s Forest to Harwood; thence southerly along the centre of the said
parochial road to its junction with the new main road from Alston via Tweedside
to Grantham; thence south-easterly along the centre of the said main road to
the White Rock River; thence up the centre of the White Rock River to the
eastern boundary of Harwood’s Patent; thence southerly along the eastern bound-
ary of Harwood’s Patent to the boundary of Liecesterfield; thence easterly and
southerly along the boundary between Liecesterfield and Logie Green to the
Rio Minho; thence up the centre of the Rio Minho to the main road from Rit-
chie to Spaldings at or near the Moravian Church; thence souther1 along the
centre of the said main road to its junction with the parochial roadlleading to
Ginger Hall between the 7th and 8th mile posts; thence westerly along the centre
of the said parochial road to the boundary of the parishes of Manchester and
Clarendon; thence north-westerly along the said parish boundary back to the
starting point.
